description: After a night of hearing survivor stories and consulting old Council contacts, Nikola uses Halden's master credentials to verify the authenticity of hidden BCI archives.
Nikola Petrak publicly announces his decision to release the full Council archives, granting open access to all hidden records related to BCI abuses, including encrypted files left by Halden.

Crowds gather at former BCI centers and public spaces, working with released data to connect individual abuses to Council directives; early findings point to deliberate score manipulation and enforced disappearances.
Citizen-led tribunals begin, livestreaming evidence and testimony; Council members are called to account, and the depth of systemic abuse is exposed citywide.
Facing overwhelming evidence and public outrage, a majority of Council members resign in real time; interim oversight is transferred to a citizen-chosen assembly for the first time.
